content.description: Three feet from the left arete of this face, climb the slab on a variety of good ledges and fun incut holds. The actual line climbs the bulge near the top, but there are plenty of variations along this face, all v0. Good warm-ups.
content.protection: Pads. Mostly flat landing, except an annoying rock underneath the bulge.
content.location: On back left side of SPF boulder from the trail, adjacent to the diving board boulder in the talus field.

content.description: Start in the middle of the detached horizontal at about waist height. The flat ledge for your feet is off. Pull the small roof onto a right-hand three-finger triangle ledge, and continue up on good ledges. Top out any way you can.
content.location: When you approach the SPF boulder it is in the middle of the first side you see, to the left of the tree. There is a large, slanted boulder leaning on the left side of this boulder. Detached horizontal is usually chalked well.

content.description: 20 foot jug haul with a bad landing. Pad the base well or just don't fall.
content.location: Facing the SPF boulder from the trail it is the face right of the tree/arete, about four feet from the arete

content.description: Start at the undercling under the small roof and climb the fun, tall arete. The holds get better the higher you go, which is a good thing because the landing is terible.
